alert.note: Alert for Hughes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 5:20PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hughes County through 545 PM CDT... At 520 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Horntown, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holdenville, Lamar, and Horntown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
